intro: Erigeron cordatus, commonly known as the heartleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically blue to purple in color. Erigeron cordatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
